result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert C. Orvis

records.addlTxt:
NO RECORD MADE. Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Defendant Robert C. Orvis in court. Clerk. M.Burke.  Victim is present in court. DE and state had discussions regarding an offer. The DE would like to get an attorney.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE states he does not have an attorney and does not want one. DE states he has gotten all of the discovery. STC set to 09/22/22 at 10:00 to give the state time to talk with the DE.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Carl A., Rachel B-O., residence at 1001 72nd St - also includes no parking vehicle in front of residence.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert C. Orvis
Current: 1011 72nd St, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States  (Effective: 05-31-2022)
Prior: 1001 72nd Street, Kenosha, WI 53143

01:41 PM    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz. Victim R. B-O.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am. $750   Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
